column4: hey all, ive just bought a new hard drive and plugged it in, when i do fdisk -l, i see the device and says Not a valid partition table. it's an SSD, and I want to set it as EXT4. how can I do this?
do you want a partition table?
yes, so i can mount it
you can run fdisk and choose option c to create a partition
I may have told you the wrong letter
yes, I apologize.. n, not c
ok so i did that now what?
do a p and make sure it has Id 83
then if you're satisfied, w to write changes and q to quit
if i do L, it shows a bunch of fs types
damn its been such a while i used fdisk ...
